intro: Polystachya mildbraedii var. mildbraedii, commonly known as the mildbraed's polystachya, is a flowering plant belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
